result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:03 PM Defendant Alan H Onopa in court.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Alan H Onopa.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

4:02 p.m.  J Kiener is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Pfeil.
Exhibit #P1, Day Report Status Report, is marked for ADA Pfeil.
4:06 p.m. Witness identifies the defendant.
4:07 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Weiland.
No redirect by ADA Pfeil.
Witness is excused.
ADA Pfeil has no further witnesses.
Atty Weiland has no witnesses.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond is continued.
Court advises the defendant to either change the pre-trial supervision program or he starts to attend the program.

Atty Weiland stated that he had requested a bond modification.
ADA Pfeil will complete a stipulation to remove the PTSP condition from the bond and provide to Atty Weiland and then refer to the Court for signature.
Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
